DataElement.preferredName: Registering Institution Southwest Oncology Group Affiliation Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether the institution responsible for registering participants on the clinical trial is an affiliated Southwest Oncology Group, an NCI-sponsored cooperative group for adult cancer clinical trials headquartered in San Antonio, institution.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Registering Institution Southwest Oncology Group Affiliation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the affiliation of the institution responsible for registering participants on the clinical trial to the Southwest Oncology Group, an NCI-sponsored cooperative group for adult cancer clinical trials headquartered in San Antonio.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Registering; the act of listing or recording officially.:The buildings and organizations where healthcare services are provided.

Concepts.definition: Registering; the act of listing or recording officially.
The buildings and organizations where healthcare services are provided.

Property.preferredDefinition: The Southwest Oncology Group (SWOG) is an NCI-sponsored cooperative group, an adult cancer clinical trials organization, one of the largest in the world. The group was established in 1956 and is headquartered in San Antonio, TX. Its network consists of almost 4,000 of the physicians at 283 institutions throughout the US and Canada. The major goal of the SWOG since 1990 has been to enroll more women and minority patients in cancer treatment and control research trials.:One associated with.

Concepts.definition: An NCI-sponsored cooperative group, an adult cancer clinical trials organization, one of the largest in the world. The group was established in 1956 and is headquartered in San Antonio, TX. Its network consists of almost 4,000 of the physicians at 283 institutions throughout the US and Canada. The major goal of the SWOG since 1990 has been to enroll more women and minority patients in cancer treatment and control research trials.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.
